intro: Sarcoglottis sceptrodes, commonly known as the slender-stalked sarcoglottis, is a member of the Araceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its erect, slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, which is enclosed by a spathe. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. Sarcoglottis sceptrodes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
